translation: O worshippable Vaiṣṇava, be merciful to me this time. O saviour of the fallen, without you there is no one.

text: kāhāra nikaṭe gele pāpa dūre yāya
emana dayāla prabhu kebā kothā pāya
translation: If one comes to you, one’s sins go away. Where can such a merciful master be found?
If the Ganges touches someone, he is later purified, but you purify souls simply by seeing them—such is your power.
If one offends the Lord, the Lord’s Name delivers him, but if one offends you, one has no salvation.
Govinda always resides in your heart, and He says, “My devotees are My heart.”

text: prati janme kari āśā charaṇera dhūli
translation: In every birth I aspire for the dust of your feet. Be merciful to Narottam, considering him your own.
